basics.name: Leah (Seoyeon) Lee
basics.label: Mechanical Engineering Student
basics.summary: Mechanical Engineering undergraduate at UIUC focused on vehicle systems, mechanical design, controls, and robotics hardware.

work.name: RoboTouch Lab, University of Illinois
work.summary: Two separate research projects: (1) Self-actuated climbing robot — contact mechanism design and closed-loop control using force/pressure feedback. (2) Spherical GelSight tactile sensor — fabrication, calibration, and image reconstruction pipeline.
highlights: Designed contact mechanism and implemented closed-loop contact control for climbing robot
Built testing rigs and performed root cause analysis on inconsistent system behavior
Designed molds, performed silicone casting, and integrated PCB for tactile sensor
Developed calibration procedure and photometric stereo reconstruction pipeline (Python + OpenCV)
Patent filed for spherical sensor design; IROS conference paper in preparation

work.name: Illini Solar Car
work.summary: Design and fabricate composite fairing components for a formula-style solar race vehicle.
highlights: Designed and fabricated molds for fairing door
Carbon fiber and fiberglass composite layups with vacuum bagging
Resolved alignment and mounting issues during vehicle assembly
Coordinated with aerodynamics, structures, and electrical teams under competition deadlines
